content.value: What is Splunk? Splunk is the data platform that powers enterprise observability, unified security, and limitless custom applications in hybrid environments. Splunk is one of the most popular security solutions in the cybersecurity industry. This is why we'll show you how this product works.
Don't forget to open ports on your firewall. The default ports needed are:

value: Port 9997 for forwarders to the Splunk indexer
Port 8000 for clients to the Splunk Search page
Port 8089 for splunkd (also used by the deployment server)

content.value: If you go to services.msc you will find a 'Splunkd Service' which has a startup type 'automatic' and it must be in running status. You can monitor this service and status to check your Splunk state.
For this part, we will use an Ubuntu 22.04 Desktop computer. It will work with other distributions and a server one, but since I used the VM for other things it will be easier.

value: Go to the Splunk Site (www.splunk.com)
Create an account
Download the .deb installer
Go to your download folder
Right Click on it > Open with Other Applications > Software Install
Click on the 'Install' button and wait.
Go to the Splunk Site (www.splunk.com)
Create an account
When you try to download it, check the upper right corner
Click on 'Command Linux Wget', it will give you the command you need to download it
For this section, I will use the tgz format
Open your terminal
Go to your installation folder (/opt for me)
Paste the command given a few steps ago
Add 'sudo' if needed
Go to root user
Extract it with this command: tar xvzf splunk-VERSION-Linux-x86_64.tgz
Launch it: /opt/splunk/bin/splunk start --accept-license
Answer the questions
Try to connect to the link with the url provided by the installer
By default, Splunk on Linux doesn't run at the system startup. To make it start, run this command in root: /opt/splunk/bin/splunk enable boot-start
Restart and check the status: /opt/splunk/bin/splunk status
